title: Center of mass - platform with three rocks

content.question: The center of mass of an irregularly shaped platform is balanced on a pivot Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> with coordinates <math alttext="7.0 meters comma 1.0 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mn>7.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>,</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>)</mo></math>. Two rocks are then placed on top of the platform, as shown in the top view. One rock has a mass of <math alttext="1.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> and is located at <math alttext="the point with coordinates negative 2.0 meters comma negative 3.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>,</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>)</mo></math>, and the second rock has a mass of <math alttext="3.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> and is located at <math alttext="the point with coordinates 5.0 meters comma 4.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mn>5.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>,</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>)</mo></math>. At which coordinates should a third rock of mass <math alttext="4.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> be placed such that the three rock-platform system is balanced?
